TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PersonalizationState extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the basic functionality that represents the personalization data for a page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Classes that derive from this base class contain the actual implementation for managing, applying, and extracting personalization data. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartPersonalization> class makes use of personalization state with a reference to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState>.
If a developer writes a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> implementation, a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationProvider> must also be written. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationProvider> instances are responsible for creating and consuming <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> instances.

block.para: Derived classes should always call the base class constructor from the derived constructor.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Implementing Web Parts Personalization with a User Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager webPartManager) cil managed

Docs.param: A that manages Web Parts controls that have personalization data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The object created by this constructor manages the state for Web Parts controls that are managed by the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control.

block.para: Derived classes should always call the base class constructor from the derived constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyWebPartManagerPersonalization() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden, applies personalization data to the control associated with the personalization state instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control was a parameter in the constructor that created the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyWebPartPersonalization(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: The Web Parts control to which personalization data is applied.
Docs.summary: When overridden, applies personalization data to the specified Web Parts control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the abstract definition of the method used to apply personalization data to a Web Parts control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExtractWebPartManagerPersonalization() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden, extracts personalization information from the control associated with the current personalization state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the abstract definition of a method used to extract personalization information from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object. The associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> was a parameter in the constructor that was used to create the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExtractWebPartPersonalization(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: The Web Parts control from which personalization data is extracted.
Docs.summary: When overridden, extracts personalization data from the specified Web Parts control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the abstract definition of the method used to extract personalization data from a Web Parts control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetAuthorizationFilter(string webPartID) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetAuthorizationFilter (webPartID As String) As String

Docs.param: The ID of the Web Parts control from which the is retrieved.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the authorization filter for the specified Web Parts control.
Docs.returns: The authorization filter string for a Web Parts control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> string for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control before an instance of it is created. This method should return `null` if there is no personalized value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> property.
The Web Parts control set does not implement any default behavior for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> property. The property is provided so that a developer can assign an arbitrary string value to a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control; this property can be checked by subscribing to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.AuthorizeWebPart> event on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control on a page to determine whether the control can be added to the page.

public: property bool IsDirty { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether any personalization information has changed.
Docs.value: if any personalization state instance has changed (is "dirty"); otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartPersonalization> class checks this property to determine whether the personalization state needs to be written back to the underlying data store.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsEmpty As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsEmpty { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden, gets a value that indicates whether any personalization state was extracted by a state instance.
Docs.value: if any personalization state was extracted by a state instance; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is an abstract definition of a property that can be called to determine whether any personalization state was extracted by a state instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void SetDirty() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks the current personalization state as having changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Classes that inherit from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> can use this method to mark themselves as having changed (or being "dirty"), thus indicating the need to reserialize and save personalization state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetWebPartDirty(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: The Web Parts control to be marked as having changed.
Docs.summary: When overridden, marks a Web Parts control as having changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an abstract definition of the method used to indicate that a Web Parts control has changed (is "dirty"). The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> class exposes methods (which in turn call this method) that can be used by developers to mark a Web Parts control as "dirty," thus indicating the need to reserialize and save personalization state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetWebPartManagerDirty() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden, marks the associated control as having changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the abstract definition of the method used to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> instance associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> instance is now considered to have changed (is "dirty").
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartPersonalization> class exposes a protected method (which in turn calls this method) that can be used by developers to mark the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control as "dirty," thus indicating the need to reserialize and save personalization state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ValidateWebPart(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: The Web Parts control to be validated.
Docs.summary: Verifies that the specified Web Parts control is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method verifies that `webPart` is a valid Web Parts control. The base class verifies that `webPart` is not `null` and is managed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.
Classes that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> should validate Web Parts controls inside of any methods that work with <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> instances. This ensures that standalone <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> instances do not have state changes accidentally written into the personalization data for a page.

Docs.exception: is not currently managed by the associated with the .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WebPartManager As WebPartManager

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the control currently associated with the personalization state instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control is the object used as a parameter for the constructor that creates the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.
